mods.abstract: News article from the "Daily News" that describes the film "Hallelujah!". It was the first sound film with an all-black cast as well as the first film to use post-synchronized sound. 3 pages.

relatedItem.abstract: Hallelujah!, a film released in 1929, was the first all-black musical and was intended to be a dramatic portrayal of the lives of poor African Americans in the South. The producer and director, King Vidor, filmed on location in Memphis and Arkansas, and the interiors were shot at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer studios. Ultimately, this led the director to use post-synchronized sound, another motion picture first which is sometimes credited to the film....
